question: Will Trump win the 2024 Iowa Caucus?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if former president Donald J. Trump wins the greatest share of apportioned delegates in the 2024 Republican Iowa caucuses. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".  

If Trump ties for the greatest share of apportioned delegates, the popular vote will be used as a tiebreaker. Namely, if Trump ties for the greatest share of apportioned delegates and has the higher final popular vote number, the market resolves to "Yes", and if Trump ties for the greatest share of apportioned delegates and doesn't have the higher final popular vote number, the market resolves to "No".

If no 2024 Republican Iowa caucuses take place, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source for this market will be the first announcement of the results from the Iowa Republican party, however an overwhelming consensus of credible reporting may suffice.

Namely, if Trump ties for the greatest share of apportioned delegates and has the higher final popular vote number, the market resolves to "Yes", and if Trump ties for the greatest share of apportioned delegates and doesn't have the higher final popular vote number, the market resolves to "No".

If no 2024 Republican Iowa caucuses take place, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source for this market will be the first announcement of the results from the Iowa Republican party, however an overwhelming consensus of credible reporting may suffice.

question: Will Credit Suisse fail by March 31?
description:
The market will resolve to "Yes" if Credit Suisse experiences any of the following between March 14 and March 31, 2023, 11:59:59 PM ET:

-Credit Suisse files for bankruptcy protection or is being declared insolvent by a court.
-Credit Suisse is closed or its operations are taken over by the Swiss government.
-Credit Suisse is acquired by, merged with, or its assets & liabilities are absorbed by another entity.
-The Swiss government intervenes to provide financial assistance, either in the form of equity or loans, to prevent the Credit Suisse's collapse.

Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution sources for this market will be announcements by Credit Suisse Group AG, the Swiss National Bank (SNB), and/or the Swiss Financial Market Supervisory Authority (FINMA), however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: NCAAB: Texas Southern Tigers vs. Fairleigh Dickinson Knights 2023-03-15
description:
In the upcoming NCAAB game, scheduled for March 15 at 6:40 PM ET:

If the Texas Southern Tigers win, the market will resolve to “Texas Southern”.

If the Fairleigh Dickinson Knights win, the market will resolve to “Fairleigh Dickinson”.

 If the game is not completed by April 10, 2023 (11:59:59 PM ET), the market will resolve 50-50.
